posts.post_content:
Soooooo underrated. This card single-handedly won me almost every sealed match I've played in. Forcing a guy to tap out and inflict 3 points of damage is fantastic. You can force a weak guy to attack, take the damage or toss it into a wall.
  
   
The great thing is that he can't keep someone like a [Prodigal Pyromancer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Prodigal Pyromancer) sitting around to help kill a larger creature, he HAS to attack with it or tap out early and take the damage.
  
   
2 of these things will kill someone in short order, or remove the blockers so that you can run him over with other creatures.
  
   
As a final benefit, the opponent may have to waste their own removal on their own guy, giving you that much more protection for your own troops.
  
   
5/5, fantastic card.
posts.html:
Soooooo underrated. This card single-handedly won me almost every sealed match I've played in. Forcing a guy to tap out and inflict 3 points of damage is fantastic. You can force a weak guy to attack, take the damage or toss it into a wall.

The great thing is that he can't keep someone like a Prodigal Pyromancer sitting around to help kill a larger creature, he HAS to attack with it or tap out early and take the damage.

2 of these things will kill someone in short order, or remove the blockers so that you can run him over with other creatures.

As a final benefit, the opponent may have to waste their own removal on their own guy, giving you that much more protection for your own troops.

5/5, fantastic card.

posts.post_content: I think quite a few people are under-rating this card. Think about it. [Perimeter Captain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Perimeter Captain) plus [Wall of Omens](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wall of Omens), then this on top? That's a lightning bolt every turn for three mana while you're gaining life. Also this card absolutely owns a turn two [Putrid Leech](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Putrid Leech).
